title: ClickTight Convertibles: Forward-Facing Lap-Shoulder Belt Installation with ClickTight
description:
How to install the Britax Marathon ClickTight, Boulevard ClickTight, and Advocate ClickTight convertible car seats in forward-facing mode using the vehicle lap/shoulder belt and the ClickTight Installation System. 
**Refer to your user guide for complete installation instructions.

asset.author: Britax Child Safety, Inc
asset.hookText:
How to install the Britax Marathon ClickTight, Boulevard ClickTight, and Advocate ClickTight convertible car seats in forward-facing mode using the vehicle lap/shoulder belt and the ClickTight Installation System. 
**Refer to your user guide for complete installation instructions.
For more information about Britax ClickTight convertible car seats, visit http://www.britaxusa.com/clicktight-convertibles

transcripts: Remove the tether from the compartment and retainer tabs. And place it over the child seat back. Now place the seat forth facing in the vehicle. Ensure that the base of the child seat is flawed. And that no more than three inches of the base hangs over the edge of the vehicle seat. Also check that there is no interference with the vehicle head restraint. If there is the vehicle head restraint should be raised. Removed restored or a different seating position may need to be used. Open the click tight by pressing the dimple on the clip tight dial and rotating the dial clockwise until it releases and lift to open. Pull vehicle seat belt out and slide both parts of the vehicle seat belt into the forward facing belt slots. Ensure the vehicle belt is not twisted and buckle the seat belt. Remove slack from lap and then shoulder part of the vehicle belts. Close the click type until a click is heard. The click tight logo must be in the horizontal position. And ensure that the ball in the reclining indicator is within the allowable green section for the size of the child. Check that the child cannot be moved front to back or side to side more than one inch at the belt path. Locate the designated vehicle tether anchor attach the tether. And remove slack.
